trends: There have been 18 other sightings in Windsor
There were no other sightings in Windsor on or around September 6th 2008
divs: sighting detailsthis object was observed while at sandpoint beach in windsor, ontario in the late afternoon\early evening. the object was first noticed in the northeastern sky at an apparently high altitude and was probably over some part of the state of michigan. what caught our attention was that it apparently was not moving through the sky; however it appeared to be rotating and two of us agreed that it often appeared as a boomerang shaped object. it eventually became obvious that it was moving slowly to the east and apparently further away. after approx. 10 minutes it was not visible any more. our most rational explanation for the object was that it was a weather balloon or low satellite. we were not certain if it is possible to see a satellite in daylight, but this would explain it, considering the brightness of the object and the angle from the sun. it always appeared to be rotating or pulsating. it was constantly changing shape. it was definitely an unusual object and held our attention until we lost sight of it.
Summary: Bright object visible in daylight, apparently rotating boomerang
